aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (08:53): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, why does <email/> link to a mailto: URI instead of http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webbapps/ by the way? I never find mailto: URI  useful but I can't speak for others. And ?subject= does serve a use case.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:57): you mean in DOM?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:57): I can add an archives link there
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:58): whatwg links to mailing-list because you need to subscribe and such
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (08:58): I am looking at dvcs.w3.org/hg/xhr/raw-file/tip/Overview.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:58): does it help if I add (archives) after the mailto: links?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:58): with "archives" being a link
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (08:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, I think so.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (08:59): k will do
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (09:01): Though before starting to use a offline mail client I used to moan everytime I misclicked a mailto: URI.

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:52): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: but if it's semantically more correct, I'm fine with letting it stay and have font designers take care of it some day
